head.title: THE CARS COME OUT IN SWITZERLAND

hedline.hl1: THE CARS COME OUT IN SWITZERLAND

block.p: In Europe, the auto industry's annual migration to Geneva is a sure sign of spring. Last week, movers and shakers gathered for a car show on this neutral ground -- Switzerland has no domestic automakers -- to celebrate what they have accomplished and ponder where they are going.

Mark Landler reports on the reluctance of German makers to cut carbon dioxide emissions. Nick Kurczewski looks at significant new models at the show. Richard Feast reflects on changes he has seen in a quarter-century of Geneva shows. nytimes.com/autos
